Message.Title: Too many internal Profibus slaves
Message.Description: There are too many internal Profibus slaves defined in the system.
Message.Consequences:
Profibus I/O unit <> will not be configured. No communication with this unit
will be possible.
Message.Causes:
Profibus I/O unit <> is defined as an internal slave while another
internal slave has already been configured.
The maximum number of internal slaves is 1.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure the system parameters are correct.
2. Make sure the Profibus binary file is correct.

Message.Title: Too many I/O units on I/O bus
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration for I/O unit <> is invalid.
The number of I/O units on I/O bus <> must not exceed .
This I/O unit has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Reduce the number of defined I/O units and reboot the system.

Message.Title: Incorrect Interbus unit type
Message.Description: I/O unit <> at address <> has a unit type not supported by the system.
Message.Consequences: The I/O unit has not been configured, and cannot be used by the system.
Message.Causes: One or more of the units connected to the network is of a hardware version not supported by the system.
Message.Actions:
1. Replace the unsupported I/O unit with one of the correct version.
2. Make sure the system parameters are correct.
3. Reconfigure the Interbus network.

Message.Title: I/O unit not defined in Interbus configuration
Message.Description: I/O unit <.> is not assigned to any address in the Interbus configuration.
Message.Consequences: The I/O unit has not been configured, and cannot be used by the system.
Message.Causes: Data for defining the I/O unit is missing in the Interbus configuration.
Message.Actions: Change the Interbus configuration using the CMD tool under the Process Data menu. Add an address for the I/O unit. The CMD tool is available from your local ABB representative.

Message.Title: No access to Interbus data
Message.Description: Access to the Interbus board data interface is denied. not performed, error code .
Message.Actions:
1. The Interbus board may be faulty. Replace any faulty boards if required.
2. Check the Interbus internal configuration.

Message.Title: Interbus I/O unit configuration mismatch
Message.Description: The Interbus I/O unit with address <> is configured in the system parameters, but not in the Interbus configuration.
Message.Consequences: The I/O unit has not been configured, and cannot be used by the system.
Message.Causes: The Interbus unit address in the Interbus configuration differs from that in the system parameters, or the I/O unit may not have been configured at all in the Interbus configuration.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure system parameters are correct.
2. Reconfigure the Interbus network.

Message.Title: Interbus I/O unit configuration mismatch
Message.Description: The Interbus I/O unit with address <.> is configured in the Interbus configuration, but not in the system parameters.
Message.Consequences: The I/O unit has not been configured, and cannot be used by the system.
Message.Causes: The Interbus unit address in the Interbus configuration differs from that in the system parameters, or the I/O unit may not have been configured at all in the system parameters.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure system parameters are correct.
2. Reconfigure the Interbus network.

Message.Title: Cannot configure Interbus board
Message.Description: An error has occurred when downloading Interbus configuration file to the Interbus board. Interbus specific error code: .
Message.Consequences: The I/O bus has not been configured, and cannot be used by the system.
Message.Causes: The path specifying the Interbus configuration files points out the wrong files or that configuration file is incorrect.
Message.Actions:
1. Use RobotStudio to check the path to the configuration files.
2. Make sure the configuration files are correct.
3. Check the Interbus specific error code as specified in the Interbus Manuals: Firmware Service and Error Messages.

Message.Title: Interbus configuration file not found
Message.Description: The Interbus configuration file <>, configured in the system parameters, was not found.
Message.Consequences: The I/O bus has not been configured, and cannot be used by the system.
Message.Causes: The Interbus configuration file does not exist or the path specified in the system parameters was incorrect.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure the Interbus configuration files are correctly located.
2. Use RobotStudio to check the path to the configuration files.

Message.Title: Cannot read the Interbus configuration file
Message.Description: An error occurred when attempting to read the Interbus board configuration file <>.
Message.Consequences: The I/O bus has not been configured, and cannot be used by the system.
Message.Actions:
1. Reload the Interbus configuration file to the robot controller.
2. Restart the system.

Message.Title: Interbus bus failure
Message.Description: The control system has lost communication with the Interbus network. Interbus specific error code: .
Message.Consequences: Parts of the Interbus network will not be accessible, depending on the network topology and the nature of the fault.
Message.Causes: A number of errors may cause this. Further information may be found in the standard Interbus documentation.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure all communication cables and connectors are working correctly and of the recommended type
2. Check the Interbus specific error code as specified in the Interbus Manuals: Firmware Service and Error Messages.

Message.Title: Transport layer failure
Message.Description: The physical channel for transport layer is invalid.
Message.Actions: Verify that the physical channel is valid, see manual.

Message.Title: Fieldbus comm. failure
Message.Description: Communication with '' master failed on unit with mac id .
Message.Actions: 1. Check the connection to the gateway.

Message.Title: CAN comm. failure
Message.Description:
CAN communication failed due to .
Code:

Message.Title: I/O unit configuration mismatch
Message.Description: I/O unit <> with address is configured in the system parameters, but it cannot be found in the I/O bus specific configuration.
Message.Causes:
1. The address of the I/O unit in the system parameters are not the same as in the I/O bus specific configuration.
2. The I/O unit has not been configured at all in the I/O bus specific configuration.
Message.Actions:
1. Check I/O unit configuration in system parameters
2. Check I/O bus specific configuration

Message.Title: Interbus bus failure
Message.Description: The control system was unable to determine the bus operating mode of the Interbus board.
Message.Actions: Restart the system.

Message.Title: Communication established with I/O unit
Message.Description: Communication established with I/O unit <>.

Message.Title: Mount permission denied
Message.Description: Permission was denied to mount the directory <> on the server <>.
Message.Actions: Check the username and password.

Message.Title: Mount path is too large
Message.Description:
Mount path is too large. Mount path consists of FTP server mount point and server path.
- Max length: <>
- Protocol used: <>
Message.Actions: Change FTP server mount point or server path.

Message.Title: Memory partition is too big
Message.Description: The memory partition for communication purposes cannot be allocated. The requested partition kB. System partition will be used.
Message.Actions: Decrease commPartSize.

Message.Title: Could not add FTP device
Message.Description:
Adding the FTP device <> to the operating system failed.
Application protocol <>.
Message.Actions: Change the local path of the configuration of the FTP device.

Message.Title: Invalid local path
Message.Description: Local path of the FTP device <> is invalid.
Message.Actions: Local path must end with :

Message.Title: Invalid input size
Message.Description: On DeviceNet I/O unit <> the connection 1 input size does not match the I/O unit.
Message.Actions:
1. Change size in configuration.
2. Check module.
3. Use DN_GENERIC unit type

Message.Title: Invalid output size
Message.Description: On DeviceNet I/O unit <> the connection 1 output size does not match the I/O unit.
Message.Actions:
1. Change size in configuration.
2. Check module.
3. Use DN_GENERIC unit type

Message.Title: Invalid input size
Message.Description: On DeviceNet I/O unit <> the connection 2 input size does not match the I/O unit.
Message.Actions:
1. Change size in configuration.
2. Check module.

Message.Title: Invalid output size
Message.Description: On DeviceNet I/O unit <> the connection 2 output size does not match the I/O unit.
Message.Actions:
1. Change size in configuration.
2. Check module.

Message.Title: Invalid connection type
Message.Description: The DeviceNet I/O unit <> does not support connection.
Message.Actions:
1. Change connection 1 type and/or connection 2 type in configuration.
2. Use DN_GENERIC unit type.

Message.Title: Duplicated address
Message.Description: The address <> for the DeviceNet master on I/O bus <> is occupied by another I/O unit on the network.
Message.Actions:
1. Change master address in configuration.
2. Disconnect I/O unit occupying the address from the network.
3. Restart the system.

Message.Title: No power on DeviceNet bus
Message.Description: The 24 V power supply from the DeviceNet power supply is missing.
Message.Consequences: No communication on the DeviceNet bus <> is possible.
Message.Causes: The power supply unit, cabling, input voltage to the power supply or the output load may cause the power loss. See the Trouble Shooting Manual and Circuit Diagram!
Message.Actions:
1. Check all cabling to the power supply unit.
2. Measure the output and input voltage levels.
3. Replace the faulty I/O unit if required.

Message.Title: DeviceNet bus communication warning
Message.Description: A minor number of communication errors occurred on DeviceNet bus <>.
Message.Consequences: Normal operation will be maintained, even on the DeviceNet.
Message.Causes: The fault may be caused by interference, power supply units and cables, or communication cables.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure any terminating resistors are correctly connected.
2. Make sure all communication cables and connectors are working correctly and of the recommended type.
3. Check network topology and cable length.
4. Make sure the DeviceNet Power Supply unit is working correctly. Replace any faulty unit.

Message.Title: Bus off, DeviceNet bus communication failure
Message.Description: A major number of communication errors occurred on DeviceNet bus <>.
Message.Consequences: All communication on the DeviceNet Bus has stopped.
Message.Causes: The fault may be caused by interference, power supply units and cables, or communication cables.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure the DeviceNet Power Supply unit is working correctly. Replace any faulty I/O unit.
2. Make sure any terminating resistors are correctly connected.
3. Make sure all communication cables and connectors are working correctly and of the recommended type.
4. Check network topology and cable length.
5. Restart the system.

Message.Title: No DeviceNet option has been installed
Message.Description: A DeviceNet master/slave board has been fitted, but no DeviceNet option has been installed.
Message.Consequences: No communication on the DeviceNet is possible. There may be consequential errors from configuring DeviceNet when no such option has been installed.
Message.Causes: An attempt may have been made to add the DeviceNet functionality, without installing the option correctly.
Message.Actions:
1. If the DeviceNet option is required: configure a new system with this option, and install the system.
2. If the DeviceNet option is not required: configure a new system without this option, and install the system.

Message.Title: Invalid DeviceNet vendor id
Message.Description:
The vendor id read from DeviceNet I/O unit <> doesn't match value in unit type configuration.
- Configuration: <>
- Actual: <>
Message.Actions:
1. Change vendor id in configuration.
2. Check that the type of I/O unit is correct.

Message.Title: Invalid DeviceNet device type
Message.Description:
The device type read from DeviceNet I/O unit <> doesn't match value in unit type configuration.
- Configuration: <>
- Actual: <>
Message.Actions:
1. Change device type in configuration.
2. Check that the type of I/O unit is correct.

Message.Title: Invalid DeviceNet product code
Message.Description:
The product code read from DeviceNet I/O unit <> doesn't match value in unit type configuration.
- Configuration: <>
- Actual: <>
Message.Actions:
1. Change product code in configuration.
2. Check that the type of I/O unit is correct.

Message.Title: DeviceNet unknown error
Message.Description: An unknown error is reported from I/O unit <> error code .
Message.Actions:
1. Restart the system.
2. Report problem to ABB.

Message.Title: DeviceNet generic connection 1
Message.Description:
On DeviceNet I/O unit <> connection 1 configuration are generic.
Real values:
- Connection 1 type: <>
- Connection 1 input size: <>
- Connection 1 output size: <>
Message.Actions:
1. Create a new unit type with correct values.
2. Update your current unit type configuration.

Message.Title: DeviceNet generic connection 2
Message.Description:
On DeviceNet I/O unit <> connection 2 configuration are generic.
Real values:
- Connection 2 type: <>
- Connection 2 input size: <>
- Connection 2 output size: <>
Message.Actions:
1. Create a new unit type with correct values.
2. Update your current unit type configuration.

Message.Title: DeviceNet generic unit identification
Message.Description:
On DeviceNet I/O unit <> identity configuration are generic.
Real values:
- Vendor Id: <>
- Product code: <>
- Device type: <>
Message.Actions:
1. Create a new unit type with correct values.
2. Update your current unit type configuration.

Message.Title: DeviceNet I/O unit connection error
Message.Description: DeviceNet I/O unit <> is occupied by another master.
Message.Actions:
1. Check configuration.
2. Cycle power on I/O unit.

Message.Title: Unable to established communication on DeviceNet bus
Message.Description: Unable to established communication on DeviceNet bus <> because no I/O units are physically connected.
Message.Actions:
1. Check cables and connectors.
2. Connect I/O units to I/O bus.
3. Restart the system.
4. Remove I/O units on the I/O bus <> from the configuration.

Message.Title: DeviceNet I/O unit explicit connection not enabled
Message.Description: DeviceNet I/O unit <> does not have the explicit message connection enabled.
Message.Actions: Change configuration.

Message.Title: Fieldbus command type order number not unique.
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
Fieldbus command <> and <> are connected to the same unit type <> and have the same order number <>.
The order number of commands connected to the same I/O unit must be unique.
This command has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Correct the configuration.

Message.Title: Invalid fieldbus command type
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
One of the fieldbus commands has a reference to an invalid/unknown command type < >.
All fieldbus commands must refer to an existing command type.
This fieldbus command has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Correct the fieldbus command type for the command.

Message.Title: Max number of fieldbus commands exceeded
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The maximum number, , of fieldbus commands in the I/O system has been exceeded.
Message.Actions: Modify the configuration of the I/O system (by reducing the number of fieldbus commands) so that the maximum limit is not exceeded.

Message.Title: Max number of fieldbus command types exceeded
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The maximum number , of fieldbus command types in the I/O system has been exceeded.
Message.Actions: Modify the configuration of the I/O system (by reducing the number of fieldbus command types) so that the maximum limit is not exceeded.

Message.Title: I/O unit reset
Message.Description:
The I/O unit <> on the I/O bus <> has been reset through the fieldbus command <>, to make sure that the fieldbus command values are activated.
This causes the I/O unit to loose contact while it is restarted but it will regain contact.
Message.Causes: A fieldbus command for reset has been defined for the I/O unit in the configuration of the I/O system.

Message.Title: Max number of I/O access levels exceeded
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The maximum number, , of I/O access levels in the I/O system has been exceeded.
Message.Actions: Modify the configuration of the I/O system (by reducing the number of I/O access levels) so that the maximum limit is not exceeded.

Message.Title: Invalid I/O access level
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The I/O signal <> has a reference to an invalid/undefined I/O access level <>.
All I/O signals must either omit the access level or refer to an existing access level.
This I/O signal has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Change I/O access level to one that exist or define a new I/O access level.

Message.Title: Invalid bit values
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration for I/O signal <> is invalid.
The minimum bit value <> must not be less than <>.
The maximum bit value <> must not exceed <>.
The minimum bit value must be less than the maximum bit value.
This I/O signal has been rejected.
Message.Actions:
1. Check that the I/O signal is configured with the correct encoding type.
2. Check that the min and max bit values are correct.

Message.Title: Physical limitation values out of range
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration for I/O signal <> is invalid.
The physical limitation minimum value must be less than the physical limitation maximum value.
This I/O signal has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Correct the physical limitation values for the I/O signal so that the minimum value becomes less than the maximum value.

Message.Title: Invalid I/O bus configuration
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration for I/O bus <> is invalid.
User-defined (externally loaded) I/O buses must no be specified as local.
This I/O bus has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Change the bus type of the I/O bus.

Message.Title: Invalid unit type configuration
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration for unit type < > is invalid.
User-defined (externally loaded) unit types must no be specified as local.
This I/O bus has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Change the bus type of the I/O unit type.

Message.Title: Invalid name
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The configuration instance <> does not comply with the rules of RAPID identifiers.
This configuration instance has been rejected.
Message.Actions:
Correct the name of the configuration instance so that it complies with the following rules:
Rules of RAPID identifiers:
1, The length must not exceed 16 characters.
2, The first character must be a letter (a-z or A-Z).
3, Subsequent characters must be letters (a-z or A-Z), digits (0-9) or underscores (_).

Message.Title: Invalid Connector ID
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration for I/O bus <> is invalid.
No or invalid connector ID is selected for the <> bus type.
This I/O bus has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Select a valid connector ID for the I/O bus.

Message.Title: Conflicting bus types
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration for I/O bus <> is invalid.
There are duplicated <> I/O buses with same connector ID <>.
I/O buses of the same type must have unique connector ID:s.
This I/O bus has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Correct the connector ID for the I/O bus.

Message.Title: Invalid bus type
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration for I/O bus <> is invalid.
The bus type <> is invalid or unknown
Installed valid bus types are:
Message.Consequences: This I/O bus has been rejected, and no functions depending on it will work.
Message.Actions: Correct the bus type for the I/O bus.

Message.Title: Invalid recovery time
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration for I/O bus <> is invalid.
The value of the recovery time parameter <> is incorrect.
The recovery time (how often to try regaining contact with lost I/O units) must not be less than 5 seconds.
This I/O bus has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Correct the recovery time for the I/O bus.

Message.Title: Invalid DeviceNet baud rate
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration for I/O bus <> is invalid.
The value of the DeviceNet baud rate parameter <> is incorrect.
Valid DeviceNet baud rates are:
- 125
- 250
- 500
This I/O bus has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Correct the DeviceNet baud rate for the I/O bus.

Message.Title: Command type without reference to unit type
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
No reference to a unit type is defined for the command type <>.
All command types must have a reference to an existing unit type.
This command type has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Define a unit type reference for the command type.

Message.Title: Invalid unit type
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration for command type < > is invalid.
The unit type <> is invalid/unknown.
All command types must refer to an existing/defined unit type.
This command type has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Correct the unit type for the command type.

Message.Title: Command type without path
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
No path is defined for the command type <>.
This command type has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Define a path <> for the command type.

Message.Title: Command type without service identifier
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
No service identifier is defined for the command type <>.
This command type has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Define a service identifier <> for the command type.

Message.Title: Invalid service identifier
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
service identifier <> is not valid for command type <>.
Valid service identifiers are:
<>
This command type has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Correct the service identifier for the command type.

Message.Title: Fieldbus command without reference to I/O unit
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
One of the fieldbus commands has no reference to a I/O unit.
All fieldbus commands must have a reference to an existing I/O unit.
This fieldbus command has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Define a I/O unit reference for the fieldbus command.

Message.Title: Invalid I/O unit
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
One of the fieldbus commands has a reference to an invalid/unknown I/O unit <>.
All fieldbus commands must have a reference to an existing I/O unit.
This fieldbus command has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Correct the I/O unit for the fieldbus command.

Message.Title: Fieldbus command, no reference to command type
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
One of the fieldbus commands has no reference to a command type.
All fieldbus commands must have a reference to an existing command type.
This fieldbus command has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Define a command type reference for the fieldbus command.

Message.Title: Unit type mismatch
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
One of the fieldbus commands refers to a I/O unit <> and a command type <> that refer to different unit types.
The I/O unit and command type referred to by a fieldbus command must refer to the same unit type.
This fieldbus command has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Correct the configuration.

Message.Title: Unit map undefined
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration for I/O signal <> is invalid.
Unit map is undefined or empty.
A unit map must be specified for all physical I/O signals (i.e. signals connected to an unit).
This I/O signal has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Define a unit map for the I/O signal.

Message.Title: Unit map out of range
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration for I/O signal <> is invalid.
The unit map <> is invalid since bit <> is out of range.
All bits in the unit map must be in the range [0, ].
This I/O signal has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Correct the unit map.

Message.Title: Unit map with overlapping segments
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration for I/O signal <> is invalid.
The unit map <> contains segments (e.g bit ) that overlap each other.
This I/O signal has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Correct the unit map.

Message.Title: Unit map with unexpected character
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration for I/O signal <> is invalid.
Found unexpected end or character at position <> in the unit map: <>.
This I/O signal has been rejected.
Message.Actions:
Correct the unit map so that is comply with the following syntax:
- {bit} = ([0-9]+)
- {range} = ([0-9]+[-][0-9]+)
- {segment} = ({bit} | {range})
- {unit map} = ({segment}[,])*{segment}
Examples of valid unit maps:
- "1"
- "0-7, 15-8"
- "1,4-3,7"

Message.Title: Invalid signal size
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration for I/O signal <> is invalid.
There is a mismatch between the signal type and the size of the signal.
The signal size <> is given by the unit map: <>.
This I/O signal has been rejected.
Message.Actions:
Correct either the signal type or the unit map so that the following rules are fulfilled:
- The size of digital I/O signals must be exactly one bit.
- The size of analog and group I/O signals must be between 2 and 32 bits.

Message.Title: Invalid bus type
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The unit type <> has an invalid/unknown bus type <>.
Installed valid bus types are:
Message.Consequences: This unit type has been rejected, and no functions depending on it will work.
Message.Actions: Correct the bus type for the unit type.

Message.Title: Invalid connection 1 type
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The unit type <> has an invalid/unknown type for connection 1 <>.
The type for connection 1 must be one of the following:
- POLLED
- STROBE
- COS
- CYCLIC
- COS_ACKSUP
- CYCLIC_ACKSUP
This unit type has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Correct the connection 1 type of the unit type.

Message.Title: Invalid connection 2 type
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The unit type <> has an invalid/unknown type for connection 2 <>.
The type for connection 2 must either be omitted or one of the following:
- POLLED
- STROBE
- COS
- CYCLIC
- COS_ACKSUP
- CYCLIC_ACKSUP
This unit type has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Correct the connection 2 type of the unit type.

Message.Title: Unit without reference to unit type
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
No reference to a unit type is defined for the I/O unit <>.
This I/O signal has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Define a unit type reference for the I/O unit.

Message.Title: I/O unit without reference to I/O bus
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
No reference to a I/O bus is defined for the I/O unit <>.
This I/O unit has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Define a I/O bus reference for the I/O unit.

Message.Title: Invalid trustlevel
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
Unit type <> has an invalid/unknown trustlevel <>.
Valid trustlevel values are:
- 0 (Required)
- 1 (Error when lost)
- 2 (Loss accepted)
- 3 (Stop when lost)
This command type has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Correct the trustlevel for the unit type.

Message.Title: Bus type mismatch
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
Unit <> refers to a I/O bus and a unit type with different bus types.
This I/O unit has been rejected.
Message.Actions:
1. Check that the I/O unit is connected to the correct I/O bus and that the bus type of that I/O bus is correct.
2. Check that the I/O unit refers to the correct unit type and that the bus type of that unit type is correct.
